definition: dimple/also written 酒渦|酒涡[jiu3 wo1]
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods

sentences.english: Beauty can just stay a moment , like that shallow dimple .
sentences.chinese: 美，不過一瞬，猶若那個淺淺的酒窩。

sentences.english: Doesn't dimple plastics cut have fine line to drop meeting effect effect?
sentences.chinese: 酒窩整形傷口沒好線就掉了會影響效果嗎？

sentences.english: I have two dimples. It's after my father.
sentences.chinese: 我有兩個酒窩，遺傳自我的爸爸。
那兩個淺淺的酒窩就是她的商標。

sentences.english: Where do you think dimples come from?
sentences.chinese: 你以爲酒窩是怎麼來的？

sentences.english: Two smiling dimples appeared on her round face.
sentences.chinese: 她圓圓的臉上笑盈盈地現出兩個酒窩。

sentences.english: Blind love mistakes a harelip for a dimple.
sentences.chinese: 盲目的愛情把豁嘴當酒窩。

sentences.english: In addition, sweet dimples in the cheeks, or Jiuwo, literally a pit of wines in Chinese, are definitely a plus for female charm.
sentences.chinese: 另外，雙頰上甜美的酒窩的確能爲面部魅力加分。

sentences.english: Give a pleasant smile of a woman, right cheek dimples.
sentences.chinese: 嫣然一笑，右頰有酒窩浮現。

sentences.english: Maybe it's your curly hair or the dimple you get when you smile.
sentences.chinese: 比如你的捲髮或微笑時的酒窩。

sentences.english: He bares little resemblance to the societal norm for a perfect male form. However, I am enthralled with his squishy belly and dimpled cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我卻被他的小肚子和帶着酒窩的臉蛋迷惑了。

sentences.english: And was he to blame with his dimple and his blue eyes?
sentences.chinese: 那個生個小酒窩和藍眼睛的人有什麼罪呢？

sentences.english: Her cheeks dimpled as she smiled.
sentences.chinese: 她一笑，臉上露出了酒窩。

sentences.english: You got a very cute dimple in your cheek。
sentences.chinese: 你臉上有一個好可愛的酒窩。

sentences.english: This pretty girl has dimples on her cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 這個美麗的女孩兩頰都有酒窩兒。

sentences.english: In the eyes of a lover pockmarks are dimples.
sentences.chinese: 在的眼裏，麻子也了喜歡的酒窩。

definition: (of fruit etc) fresh/(of a person etc) full of life/healthy-looking/(of eyes) moist and bright/lustrous
lit. cherry mouth (idiom)/fig. a delicate, ruby-lipped mouth
hand gesture in traditional dances (joined thumb and middle finger, the rest extended)
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
young married woman/mistress/(fig.) punching bag/(old) child bride
